TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . The respondent Government are represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

In DATE the applicant applied for a patent for an invention . In DATE ORG issued the patent to the applicant . In DATE ORG and ORG fixed the royalties to be paid to the applicant for the exploitation of the invention covered by the patent . The exploitation of the invention was then assigned to a ORG enterprise , together with a special fund to cover the royalties due to the inventors including the applicant .

In DATE , after the applicant had received CARDINAL NORP lei ( ROL ) , the payment of further royalties was suspended . In DATE ORG adopted law no . MONEY which considerably reduced the royalties payable for the use of inventions . In DATE ORG adopted law no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL which provided , inter alia , for compensation to be given to persons who had suffered loss as a result of the prejudicial effects of law no . MONEY .
On DATE the applicant lodged with ORG of GPE a claim for the royalties which the above - mentioned ORG enterprise owed him under the original patent for the use of the invention .
On DATE , ORG of GPE allowed the claim and ordered the enterprise to pay the applicant ROL CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL in royalties as well as court fees amounting to ORG .

Both parties appealed . The applicant , being dissatisfied with the amount awarded , argued that the first instance court had failed to take account of the need to index - link the TIME rate and the minimum wage when calculating the compensation due to him on the basis of his original patent . The defendant argued that , in DATE , it had stopped using the method which was the central feature of the applicant ’s invention . For that reason , the applicant ’s entitlement to compensation after that date was time - barred .

On DATE ORG allowed the applicant ’s appeal and amended in part the decision of ORG of GPE by awarding him ORG in compensation . The court rejected the defendant enterprise ’s appeal and upheld the remainder of the decision .

The defendant lodged an appeal with ORG against both decisions , arguing that the applicant ’s action had been lodged out of time . On DATE , ORG rejected the appeal as unfounded and upheld the decisions of ORG and ORG , finding that the applicant had lodged his action in time .

On DATE the applicant and the chief - engineer employed by the defendant enterprise signed the minutes of a preliminary settlement meeting wherein it was stated that ORG funds for payment of ORG royalties had never been made available to the enterprise . The TIME further mentioned that , before drawing up the record of negotiations , ORG and ORG were to specify the manner in which the sum due to the applicant was to be paid .

In DATE the applicant complained to ORG about the non - enforcement of the original judgment . In a letter of DATE ORG informed the applicant that the judgment had to be implemented , failing which the applicant could lodge a further claim for damages .

On DATE , following the applicant ’s request , the bailiffs of ORG of GPE drew up TIME on the enforcement of the judgment of DATE . TIME mentioned inter alia that the director general of the enterprise had declared that he was aware of the sum owed to the applicant pursuant to that judgment , but that the sum in question could not be paid on account of lack of funds ; the bailiffs had therefore seized CARDINAL items of the enterprise ’s stock valued at ORG and ORG , respectively . These items remained on the enterprise ’s LOC . The bailiffs also fixed a CARDINAL days’ time limit for the enforcement of the judgment . On an unspecified date in DATE , the bailiffs informed the applicant that they had failed to sell the goods seized from the enterprise as no potential purchasers had been found .

In a letter dated DATE , following the applicant ’s complaint about the non - enforcement of the above judgment , ORG informed the applicant that it was a minority shareholder in the enterprise , that the enterprise was in financial difficulties and was not therefore in a position to satisfy the applicant ’s judgment debt . The letter mentioned that the ORG had decided that the enterprise should pay the applicant an advance of ROL CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL by DATE , the rest being paid once the seized goods had been sold . However , no action was ever taken to enforce that decision .

On an unspecified date in DATE , CARDINAL of the enterprise ’s creditor companies instituted bankruptcy proceedings against the enterprise . On DATE , in accordance with the Government Ordinance no . CARDINAL of DATE concerning the enforcement of debts payable to the ORG budget , various assets of the debtor enterprise were sold at a public auction .

On DATE the ORG made the debtor enterprise subject to liquidation proceedings in accordance with law no . CARDINAL concerning judicial reorganisation and bankruptcy . The court also appointed CARDINAL of the creditor companies as administrator of the assets of the debtor enterprise .
On DATE the ORG declared the debtor enterprise bankrupt .
The relevant provisions of Law no . CARDINAL on patents of CARDINAL DATE read as follows :
Section CARDINAL

“ Disputes concerning the capacity of an inventor or patent holder , other rights arising from a patent , including the inventor ’s pecuniary rights , as well as from contracts of assignment and licence ( ... ) , fall within the competence of the courts of law ( ... ) . ”
Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL )

“ Pecuniary rights due to inventors on the basis of patents granted to them for their inventions which have been exploited , partially remunerated or unremunerated , prior to the entry into force of the present law , shall be negotiated between the inventor and the entity which has used the invention . ( ... ) Should the parties fail to reach an agreement , the pecuniary rights shall be established pursuant to the provisions of LAW of this law . ”
The relevant provisions of ORG DATE approving the Regulation concerning the application of PERSON no . CARDINAL on patents of CARDINAL DATE read as follows :
LAW
“ The pecuniary rights of inventors provided in LAW
Rule CARDINAL - Inventions applied and unremunerated or partially remunerated

( CARDINAL ) ( ... ) These pecuniary obligations shall be considered due as a result of the non - fulfilment by the ORG , represented by the entities to which the patent had been granted and other entities which have exploited the inventions , of its legal and contractual obligations ( ... ) . ”
The relevant provisions of LAW read as follows :
“ Any enforcement proceedings may be challenged by any aggrieved person or other person concerned . “
The relevant provisions of Law no . CARDINAL on judicial reorganisation and bankruptcy of CARDINAL DATE read as follows :
Section CARDINAL
“ The present PERSON shall be applicable to commercial entities - natural persons or commercial enterprises - , which are unable to meet their commercial debts ( ... ) .
Section CARDINAL
( CARDINAL ) Any creditor , which has a specific , liquid and enforceable debt , shall be entitled to bring before a court a claim against the debtor , which for DATE has ceased to make payments .
Section CARDINAL

( CARDINAL ) Within TIME from the registration of the creditor ’s claim ( ... ) , the judge appointed to administer the assets of the debtor shall forward a copy of the claim to the debtor ( ... ) . ”
